articles.description: Referees' body PGMOL terminates the employment of Premier League official David Coote with immediate effect following a "thorough investigation".
articles.title: David Coote: Premier League official sacked with immediate effect

articles.description: A shortlist of six contenders has been announced for the 2024 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.
articles.title: Sports Personality of the Year 2024 nominees: Bellingham, Hodgkinson, Littler, Root, Storey and Yee

articles.description: Baseball star Juan Soto is to reportedly sign the biggest contract in the sport's history after agreeing a $765m (£600m) deal over 15 years with the New York Mets.
articles.title: Biggest deal in history of sport: Juan Soto and New York Mets agree reported £600m ($765m) contract

articles.description: Olympic discus champion Roje Stona and Australia rugby union international Jordan Petaia will be among the latest group of athletes to take part in the NFL's International Player Pathway.
articles.title: NFL's International Player Pathway: Roje Stona, Jordan Petaia and Aaron Sexton in class of 2025

articles.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.
articles.title: Ramon Diaz at Oxford United: The story of how Argentine took charge of League Two club

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler's victory in the Bahamas on Sunday, albeit over a limited field, emphatically emphasised his position as the world's best golfer, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: 'Tiger Woods impressed as sensational Scottie Scheffler continues to make points'

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says he is happy his time with Mercedes "finished on a high" after "a really turbulent year".
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton says he 'finished on a high' at Mercedes after 12 years together

articles.description: Emma Raducanu spent 2024 trying to rebuild after missing a year through injury - BBC Sport analyses how her season panned out.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu: How British tennis star's 2024 injury comeback has unfolded

articles.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says Chelsea are ahead of where he expected them to be, but the Blues boss doesn't believe they are ready to be title contenders yet.
articles.title: Enzo Maresca: Chelsea boss says second-placed side are ahead of expectations

articles.description: McLaren's first constructors' championship since 1998 came after the team needed "great resilience and great belief" to return to the top of F1.
articles.title: Lando Norris on McLaren's long but 'lovely' journey back to the top of F1
